result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Anthony Dabney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA and all applicable fees of supervision by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- Obtain/maintain full time employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Anthony Dabney

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 72 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Mark Anthony Dabney in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Mark Anthony Dabney in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Mark Anthony Dabney in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Mark Anthony Dabney in custody.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea and sentencing hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 06/08/2015 is vacated.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Mark Anthony Dabney not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Scheduling conference, defense requests final pre-trial and SPEEDY jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 04/17/2015 received and filed. (15 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Alexis Stewardt, 819 N. 6th Street, 9th Floor, Public Defender.

Defendant Mark Anthony Dabney in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Mark Anthony Dabney in custody.  Ron Dague for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Curtis Goens-Franklin Police Department Sergeant.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch  22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mark Anthony Dabney in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Mark Anthony Dabney in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
 Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Letter received from an in-custody defendant who is requesting warrant be resolved.  Copy of letter forwarded to S. Schrader, DA's Office, for action.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
